definition: to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

sentences.english: A rebel force was beguiled into ambush.
sentences.chinese: 一支叛軍受誘騙中了埋伏。

sentences.english: The system focuses on the counterwork stage between decoy and torpedo.
sentences.chinese: 該系統將目標定位於聲誘餌誘騙魚雷的對抗階段。

sentences.english: He beguiled me into signing that contract.
sentences.chinese: 他誘騙我簽了那份合同。

sentences.english: He beguiled me into lending him the money.
sentences.chinese: 他誘騙我把錢借給了他。

sentences.english: He cheated her into marrying a rich married man.
sentences.chinese: 他誘騙她嫁給一個有錢的已婚男子。

sentences.english: Gowardesh decoy through oil meat, security group had oceans.
sentences.chinese: 狗娃誘騙過油肉，保安團裏有大洋。

sentences.english: So he concocted a fiendish scheme to trick her into paying.
sentences.chinese: 於是他編造了一個殘忍的計劃，以誘騙她支付。

sentences.english: The visitors were shanghaied into buying fake goods.
sentences.chinese: 遊客被誘騙購買了假貨。

sentences.english: The girls decoy more easily than most other children.
sentences.chinese: 這些女孩比其他大多數孩子們更容易被誘騙。

sentences.english: The girl was beguiled into thinking she could become a famous singer.
sentences.chinese: 這女孩被誘騙，誤以爲她能成爲一名著名歌唱家。

sentences.english: He cooked up a scheme to cheat some of the women in the royal harem.
sentences.chinese: 他僞造名單誘騙了一些後宮嬪妃。

sentences.english: The young man inveigled the old lady into parting with her life's savings.
sentences.chinese: 那位年青人誘騙那位老太太把她的一生積蓄分給他。

sentences.english: She enticed the children with candy.
These firms' strategy was premised on one, beguiling fact.
sentences.chinese: 這些公司的策略是以一個誘騙性的事實爲前提。

definition: to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to use gain as a lure
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
